creator: dbrosius@mebigfatguy.com
text:
runStatements checks
(!sql.equals(""))when equals uses == semantics, 
changed to (sql.length() > 0)

creator: dbrosius@mebigfatguy.com
text:
Created attachment 15974
[PATCH] fix runStatements empty query check

creator: peterreilly@apache.org
text:
The !sql.equals("") code is the same as sql.length() > 0 code, except
that it is a little less efficient.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text:
I would have thought, like Peter, the existing code was fine.  But I am curious
what you meant, Dave, by

runStatements checks
(!sql.equals(""))when equals uses == semantics

?

creator: dbrosius@apache.org
text:
the variable sql, is a StringBuffer not a String. So far as i know, StringBuffer
doesn't implement the equals(Object o) method, and so by the powers of
overriding, is implemented in the Object class. Thus this line uses == semantics.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 37764 ***

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: Dave, you're duplicating your own bugs.  Slow down!  ;)
